intro: Pimpinella diversifolia var. angustipetala, commonly known as narrow-leaf cow-wheat, is a flowering plant in the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in umbels. Native to parts of Asia, this plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The species is known for its delicate appearance and is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
